The smaller peninsula, arguably has bigger and more deer than the upper, because of the farms(Well fed white tails seem to thrive and get bigger, if they can avoid the trigger happy orange army come firearm opener). This was down in South-Central Michigan. As far as hunting around this area goes, it depends. The area I am hunting is way over-crowded, so it makes it a pain sometimes. I'm actually looking at buying property because of this. A few miles further west where a friend of a friend has some private land they lease, they would have let this deer walk all day, because they have way bigger deer on their land.
